TopicTitle: How far have you gone in Kerbal Space Program?

Articles.Content: Not very far... I don't fit in the pods

I send Bill, Bob, Jeb and a couple of others to a different star system! (Though not realistic scales of cause)

Took them about 80 years.
I sent a probe past Eeloo in version 0.23.
I got a probe on a flyby near a modded planet.

I was the first user to put a flag on every body in the system although when the update with the flags was released I already had manned craft on the way to every body in the system to become a grandmaster.

This was within a month of joining the forum and before I knew that there wasn`t much else to do in the game.

Still haven`t returned from Eve.
I had a kerbal (Roley Kerman) blasted into space at high speed by the anomaly at the abandoned airstrip.
The farthest I've gone is VERY far, with my New Horizons now 2.5X farther than Sigma's Pluron-Khato system, and unlikely to slow much!
With mods ive gone interstellar
Umm... Jool for one probe, Laythe is in the works, Moho, Mercury (RSS), Duna (lvl 1 buildings), Eve.
The furthest I've been is to Neidon from the OPM mod.

Probes everywere but eeloo. Landings everywhere but Moho, Eeloo, Pol and Bop. Made a large landing ship with mining/refining capabilities. Made it easy exploring the Kerbol system. Landing on Eve was a one way ticket for a Kerbal in a big rover so he could roam around.

Eeloo takes som damn long time to get to my savegames get buggy before I arrive and I start a new game.

I've built two 50+ ton probes made almost entirely of droppable fuel tanks, one LV-N engine and a probe core with necessary paraphenalia (RTG's, batteries, antenna etc.) The goal: accelerate to maximal possible speed (using gravity assists whenever possible to squeeze some extra velocity) and leave Kerbol system without using Kraken fickle service Unfortunately soon after upgrades rolled, i started new saves and my probes never got past Jool.

But i've landed crewed missions on Eeloo

I've never really been a milestone kind of player, so I haven't landed on Eve, or done the JOOL-5, but I've visited the SOI of all the the planets and Moons.

The big turn-off for me was biome hopping, or science grinding. So I stopped doing landing on planets, and that re-invigorated my love of the game. One of my favorite play-thru was my "orbital mystery-goo" playthru, where I tried to see how much of the tech tree I could unlock using only science from -- you guessed it, mystery goo. No planetary landings. I made it to Jool, and all 5 moons and back.

I've visited every stock body in at least some sense. Dres and Vall I've yet to land on, Eve I've yet to return from.

I'm now playing with New Horizons, Kerbol Plus, Asclepius, and Boris planet packs and have barely scratched the surface of my vast and crowded system. My first Asclepius landing was the other day but I haven't tried driving the rover yet, and I have missions to the Jool and Titanus systems on the way. (Jool in New Horizons having a totally different set of moons to in stock.)
I suppose my Laythe lander is my most ambitious return so far, I really want to try Tylo next but that's going to have to be a pretty big launch.

I've gone all the way to the end... twice!

JR

I just broke Kerbin Influence in a space ship from the launch pad in one straight shot flying straight up!

8p

That is as far as I have gone since 1.0.

I am about to colonize Laythe in careerplay, several vessels are around in the Jool system waiting for further tasks...

In Laythe orbit i have a quiet big thing hanging around, kind of a... yes.

I have been everywhere, but personally, my Laythe colony was my biggest success.

Something like 112 craft all over the bloody moon.

1.0 broke the save.
Unkerbaled and kerbaled to Duna orbit once. Just to test the transfer stage. No landing yet.

I've crashed into almost every body in the starsystem. I've landed on a few as well! I actually even had a space station orbiting Duna. It was build in orbit of Kerbin and then I flew it to Duna. I really don't recommend trying this as the thing wobbled the ENTIRE way there.
I have been no further than unmanned landings on Duna. My Eve probe is ready to go tonight, if time permits. In .25 I had a Moho probe, but it had insufficient fuel to land.
I sent a 3-kerbal (Jeb, Bill, and Bob) mission to Gilly in March 2015. It was easier than it would have been now because now I think before I build something.

When I first started playing, I didn't know to look up deltaV maps and the sort. I managed to get a manned pod out to Jool in a highly elliptical orbit, but ran out of fuel to do anything else. Pretty soon Tylo flung my Kerbal on a high velocity trajectory out of the solar system. I kept playing with other missions, and that kerbal just went farther and farther and farther away. So I guess that's as far as I have gone in KSP.

I'm just doing the Ultimate Challenge (doing a fly-by on every planet & satelite with a single rocket).

This picture shows my arrival to the Jool system
